intro: Ixeris capillaris, commonly known as golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers and linear leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and roadsides. It produces small, herbaceous stems and has a mat-forming growth habit. Ixeris capillaris is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
